abstract: Metro Group, the giant German grocery and consumer goods retailer, has been a leader in applying RFID tags to shipments of goods to track their progress through its distribution chain. It is starting a new effort to test if customers will accept tags on clothes.

lead_paragraph: Followers — and opponents — of wireless tracking technology will always have a soft spot for Prada, the Italian fashion design company that ambitiously experimented with attaching RFID tags to clothing and accessories in its showcase Soho store in 2002.

headline.main: A Less Stylish Approach to RFID
